entry.title: Make Your Product Shine: Themable UI’s with Theming Parameters and Modern CSS
entry.content:
Want your product to look great in any SAP theme, without relying on the Parameters.get() API or being tightly coupled to the UI5 build?
We’ve got you covered!

We’re excited to share our latest video walkthrough on YouTube, where we show you how to use SAP’s theming parameters with modern CSS to build beautifully branded, fully themable products.
The video was recorded at the UI5con 2025.

 

 

Why watch this video?
This talk is for everyone who wants to create UI components that automatically adapt to the user’s selected theme with minimal effort and without deep integration into the UI5 tooling.

The speakers Dominik Schreiber, Andreas Rößler, and David Klug (SAP) cover in the in the session the following topics:

  • Understand the value of theming for your product and end users
  • A comparison of old vs. modern approaches
  • Leverage CSS custom properties to use SAP’s theming parameters directly
  • Use modern CSS techniques to create flexible and dynamic UIs

Want to try it yourself?
Start using the the theming parameter today in your project.
If you need more information here are some more links to get started and deep dive into custom theming.
Latest Theme Designer Help pages can be found here.
Visit also our community page and read some more interesting blog posts.
Got curious what the UI5con is and maybe want to visit next year. Have a look on their page here.

If you have any questions, feedback, or ideas, feel free to reach out to us directly we’re always happy to help.

Happy theming!

entry.title: Re: Unallocated value displayed in migrated S/4 data does...
entry.content:
According to SAP Note 2426371,

  • CKM3OLD must be used for unmigrated data (older than the last period of the year before the previous year).
  • CKM3/CKM3N shows summarized data only for migrated periods — no individual posting lines or settlement details.
  • For mixed periods, both CKM3 and CKM3OLD may be needed.

This means that summarization is expected, but distorted or inflated values are not.

In the meanwhile, if you go through SAP Note like 908776 the presence of “Not distributed” or “Not included” variances in CKM3 may indicate:

  • Incomplete multilevel consumption processing
  • Fallback strategies or price limiter logic interfering with value flow
  • Missing or inconsistent BOMs or settlement records

These are technical inconsistencies, not just reporting limitations.


To check the Material Ledger consistency, execute tcodes FIN_ML_CORR_RECONCILE and FIN_ML_CORR_DISPLAY_ISSUE. These check for missing MARA or T134M entries, inconsistent ML tables (e.g., CKMLPP, CKMLCR), Currency mismatches or valuation errors. See SAP Note 3129858for setup and usage.

Check whether CKMSTART was executed correctly. All valuation areas were migrated without errors and Price determination settings were preserved (e.g., PD “3” for actual costing)

If consistency checks reveal no errors but discrepancies persist, raise a ticket with SAP, citing your findings and SAP Note 2426371

entry.title: はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - スマートインサイト
entry.content:
本ブログシリーズはSAP Analytics CloudのBI機能をつかってダッシュボードやレポートの作成を行う方を対象とし、SAP Analytics CloudのBIにおける基本の操作やTipsをハンズオン形式でご紹介します。

本ブログでは、「ストーリーを見ている時にグラフに表示されていない分析軸を含めたより詳細な情報や差異の要因を知りたい」際に統計分析を使用してシステムが分析結果を自動的に提供してくれる機能である、スマートインサイトについてご紹介いたします。

※2025Q2アップデートで最適化ストーリーエクスペリエンスでもスマートインサイトが利用可能になりました。

 

目次：

  • スマートインサイトの概要
  • スマートインサイトの利用方法[ハンズオン]
    • スマートインサイトを利用した分析
    • スマートインサイトの分析結果をもとにストーリーを作成

※ベースとなるサンプルストーリーの作成⼿順は、はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - サンプルモデル／ストーリーの作成 - SAP Communityでご紹介しています。
※ SAP Analytics Cloudは、四半期に１度のペースで製品のバージョンアップが実施されます。そのため今後のバージョンアップにより、本ブログで紹介する画⾯キャプチャや、操作が異なる可能性があることをご了承ください。（本ブログは2025年8⽉に作成しています。）

 

スマートインサイトの概要

SAP Analytics Cloudのスマートインサイト機能は、ストーリーのチャートに表示されていない要因分析をシステムを使って自動化することで、分析を深めたい部分に関してのチャートを追加で作成することなく、ユーザーがストーリー上で即座に分析を行うことに役立ちます。ユーザーがストーリーを利用して分析していたり会議でストーリーを利用していて「ある製品の売上高が高くなっている要因を知りたい」「差異の原因を知りたい」といった際に便利です。

また、スマートインサイトはストーリーの編集モードで利用することで分析結果のチャートをストーリー作成に再利用できます。分析結果をそのままストーリーに追加することでストーリー作成を効率化したり、SAP Analytics Cloudの操作に慣れていないユーザーのストーリー作成の補助としても利用することができます。

詳しくはHelp Portalもご参照ください：スマートインサイト

スマートインサイトの利用方法

0. はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - サンプルモデル／ストーリーの作成 - SAP Communityで作成したストーリーを開こう！

 

1. スマートインサイトを使って分析しよう！

1.1. 分析したいチャートまたはデータポイントを右クリックし、メニューから「スマートインサイト」を選択します。

1.2. 画面右側にスマートインサイトパネルが表示されます。

1.3. スマートインサイトパネルで、データポイントが時間の経過とともに変化してきた状況やデータポイントへの主要なコントリビュータ、データポイントの計算方法を確認することができます。

（参考）グラフに差異が表示されている場合は、差異に対してスマートインサイトを実行し分析を行うことができます。

 

2. スマートインサイトを使ってストーリーを作成しよう！

2.1. 「編集」をクリックし、ストーリー編集モードに切り替えます。

2.2. 分析したいチャートまたはデータポイントを右クリックし、メニューから「スマートインサイト」を選択します。

2.3. 画面右側のスマートインサイトパネルの利用したいチャートから「コピー」ボタンをクリックし、「コピー」を選択します。

2.4. 「Ctrl＋V」またはメニューバーから「コピー」→「ペースト」を選択し、チャートを貼り付けます。

 必要に応じて貼り付けたチャートを編集したり、サイズを変えることなども可能です。

 

今回はスマートインサイト 機能のご紹介でした。SAP Analytics Cloudは他にも様々な表現や便利な機能があり、本ブログシリーズでご紹介しています。はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - シリーズまとめ - SAP Communityからご参照ください。

entry.title: Re: value for withholding tax (TDS) for customer against...
entry.content:
Now I got the point. JR1 is a tax condition type, not a withholding tax condition. It’s designed for sales tax jurisdiction determination, especially in U.S. scenarios. Even when JR1 is not statistical, it does not integrate with SAP’s Extended Withholding Tax framework, which is what F-28 uses to calculate and post TDS.

F-28 doesn’t read SD pricing conditions like JR1. It expects WHT data from:

  • Customer master WHT type/code
  • FI document line items
  • WHT configuration in OBY6, OBWH, etc.

Create a custom condition type say ZWHT, Condition Class be D, Calculation type be A or B. Include this condition type in your SD pricing procedure and ensure, an Account Key is assigned to this. In OB40, for that Account Key, see that it is mapped to a WHT GL account.  Once all these are done, create a new sale order and complete the cycle.

entry.title: Re: The “Add Payment Approver” dialog only allows one use...
entry.content:
According to the SAP Help  Portal, the app allows you to:

  • Add a payment approver to multiple bank accounts
  • Replace or revoke payment approvers across accounts
  • Control the process using SAP Business Workflow

However, it only allows one user ID to be added per action, which can be inefficient when onboarding multiple approvers. So what you can do is to explore some workarounds which are

  • consider using SAP APIs for Bank Account Management, Or a custom BAPI wrapper to automate mass updates. This would allow you to script the addition of multiple user IDs across accounts.
  • SAP supports dual control for bank account changes, which can streamline the approval process when multiple users are involved. See this  Blog on dual control

entry.title: SAP to Acquire SmartRecruiters: A Strategic Step Forward in Talent Acquisition
entry.content:
SAP has announced its intent to acquire SmartRecruiters, a leading provider of modern talent acquisition technology. This acquisition will mark a significant milestone in SAP's commitment to delivering the capabilities our customers need today while laying the foundation for innovation in the future. The transaction is expected to close in Q4 2025, subject to customary closing conditions, including regulatory approvals.

This planned acquisition will strengthen our innovation in talent acquisition and accelerate our ability to meet evolving customer expectations. SmartRecruiters’ deep expertise in high-volume recruiting, recruitment automation, and AI-enabled candidate experience and engagement are considered an ideal addition to the SAP SuccessFactors HCM suite. Together, we expect that customers can expect enhanced and AI-enabled recruiting and hiring capabilities, making applicant tracking and candidate screening more efficient.

Until all regulatory approvals are obtained, and the transaction is closed, both SAP and SmartRecruiters will continue to operate independently and maintain business as usual.

The transaction is expected to close in the fourth quarter of 2025, subject to customary closing conditions, including regulatory approvals. Post-close, we will begin defining the integrated product roadmap.

Read more and share the press release.

entry.title: Re: i want to change the unit of measure from EA to pc in...
entry.content:
Hi @Tarik_elh 

Unfortunately, you can’t do that.

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, once you create a material with a Base Unit of Measure (UoM) such as EA, it can't be changed to another unit like PC, even within the same material group.

Here is what I suggest you do:

  1. Create a new material under material group YBMM00
  2. Set its Base Unit of Measure to PC
  3. Use this new material in your PO exercise to enter “5 pc”

This aligns with the exercise requirements and avoids any system errors.

If my response was helpful, kindly accept the answer and award me a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Thank you for your feedback.

Kind regards

Chris

entry.title: PLM Tech Uncovered: SAP Integrated Product Development Update 07/2025
entry.content:
Curtain up on the newest features in SAP Integrated Product Development’s July 2025 release!

Collaboration
Use the Add button for the Specification Management table in the Reference Objects section in collaborations
In the My Collaborations app, you can now use the Add button for the Specification Management table in the Reference Objects section. This feature lets users select from a list of authorized and available specifications. These references are then added to the Collaboration. Participants in a collaboration can click on the link to navigate to those specifications, provided they have access.

Engineering
Compare versions
You can compare the differences between versions in Change History.

Enterprise Product Structure
Manage statuses for BOM headers
On the Structure Editor screen, you can now change the statuses of the BOM headers for both configurable and non-configurable products. You can change the statuses by using the Change Status Header button.

Product Handover
Planning limits for Hand Over Engineering Bills of Material (EBOM)
You can now only plan 25 sub-assemblies at once. Choose one of the planning types again to plan the remaining subsequent sub-assemblies.
Default target plant from source details
If a source recipe formulation is associated with a plant, the same plant defaults as the target plant when creating a handover. During this scenario, you cannot edit the target plant field.
UI enhancement in the Hand Over Recipe Formulation to Bills of Material (BOM) app
The View Details button is renamed to Customize on the handover object list page, the handover object details page, and the handover planning page.

Specification Management
Workflow triggering based on statuses
The Specification Types app now allows you to configure automatic workflow triggering based on status changes. For example, when a specification reaches the Released status, the system moves on to the next step in the selected workflow without manual intervention.
Clear phrase value from attribute fields to empty state
If you enter a phrase value for a property, you can now clear the value.

Visualization
Monitor script execution tasks in Task Monitoring app
You can now track the success and failure of script execution tasks in the Task Monitoring app.
View ECAD files
You can now have an enhanced viewing of the visualizations created from ECAD files.
You can open the ECAD models in Viewer and perform the following actions:
• Select layers of the ECAD visualization and manage their visibility in the viewport
• View mini map in the viewport and navigate through the visualization while zoomed in
• Select elements on the ECAD visualization and manage their visibility in the viewport
• Use a tool bar that lets you show or hide selected objects, rotate the electronic board clockwise or counterclockwise, flip horizontally, etc. 

To stay informed until the next update you can:
• Subscribe to the What’s New Viewer on SAP Integrated Product Development Help Portal 
• Join our LinkedIn group SAP Solutions for PLM 
• Visit us at www.sap.com/IPD

entry.title: Re: Credit card installments
entry.content:
Yes you are right. SAP does not automatically create credit card installment invoices like a boleto when a customer chooses to pay by card. Users must manually enter each installment during the payment process. This is a known limitation, especially in regions like Brazil where boleto and card installments are common.

What you can explore some options are

  • integrate with local payment providers or middleware that handle boleto generation and installment logic externally.
  • You can build a custom enhancement to automatically split card payments into installments and generate boleto-style invoices with due dates and amounts

entry.title: Re: Incorrect transfer TR to the production system if the...
entry.content:
First, there are two layers. In the lower CTS layer, at every import tp creates an import selection for the next, the delivery system, this can be only influenced with transaction STMS_PATH.

On the upper layer, the ChaRM layer which realizes a transport management workflow, the cycle reports scheduled via the task list (Change Admin Cockpit) triggers tp imports following the active import strategy. You can see which strategy is active in the last tab, the Configuration tab of the task list. If nothing is changed, the standard import strategy will be tp import project all, which is exactly what you have observed.

It seems that somebody started the Preliminary Import workflow, which triggers manual imports into the QA and PreProd systems and therefore also the import selection into the productive queue. When you move a change back to development on the higher layer, this does not change anything at the lower layer.

If you want to change the import strategy to status dependent import, then you have to go into the SPRO ChaRM TMS chapter.

entry.title: SAP Integrated Business Planning (SAP IBP) 2508 - Available Now!
entry.content:
SAP Integrated Business Planning 2508 is now generally released and it's loaded with substantial enhancements!

With SAP IBP 2508, we’re introducing the harmonized planning area I_SAPIBP2, a flexible platform for end-to-end processes across planning applications. It supports both time-series and order-based data, allowing configuration of harmonized tactical and operational supply chain planning processes with greater ease, accuracy, and maintainability.

With integrated, harmonized tools and processes, planners can smoothly adopt additional SAP IBP capabilities, leading to better reporting and planner efficiency. Improved flexibility in time-series supply planning helps businesses quickly adapt to changing demands and market conditions.

Key features of the harmonized planning area include a unified data model that covers master data types, planning levels, and key figures, ensuring consistency across planning processes. Centralized application mapping and name space management as well as a new central unit of measure and currency conversion help to streamline configuration. Additionally, planners have on-the-fly access to order key figures, enabling more informed decision-making.

The harmonized planning area introduces a new standard for seamless integration with SAP ERP, SAP S/4HANA (on premise) and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. It supports Real-Time Integration (RTI) in combination with the Cloud Integration (CI) component from the SAP Integration Suite, establishing this pairing as the new normal for fast, flexible, and robust integration. RTI enables real-time synchronization of master, order, and stock data.

SAP Cloud Integration complements this by handling key figure data transfers and offering connectivity to other SAP systems, third-party platforms, legacy systems, databases, and files.

Out-of-the-box predefined content simplifies setup and ongoing maintenance, making it easier than ever to achieve tight, efficient integration across all features of the harmonized planning area.

Now, explore with us some of the other highlights of this release:

Demand

Statistical Forecasting with AI-Powered Insights

By harnessing the power of generative AI, this feature offers explanations and recommendations to increase transparency and help planners to better understand the statistical forecast results. Simply click the "Explain" button for instant access to a comprehensive summary and detailed analysis of your latest forecast run.

Key capabilities include delivering an easy-to-understand summary of the latest forecast run for a selected planning combination, offering actionable recommendations and providing in-depth explanations of individual forecasting methods. AI-Assisted Analysis of Forecasting Results is integrated into the SAP IBP add-in for Microsoft Excel and Planner Workspaces, ensuring a smooth and efficient user experience.

This feature is currently available exclusively for early adopters. If you want to use it, contact SAP and request the activation using the SCM-IBP-DM component.

 

 

 

Planning UIs

Seamless Workflow Navigation: Effortlessly Pinpoint and Resolve Planning Challenges

Planner Workspaces streamlines your planning experience by seamlessly guiding you from identifying issues to applying solutions. SAP IBP 2508 takes this capability to new heights by integrating gating factors from order-based planning into contextual navigation.

With our enhanced workflow, you can now swiftly navigate directly to the root cause of any planning obstacle, whether it's a gating resource or component constraint. Dedicated planning views provide a clear overview of supply and demand dynamics at these critical bottlenecks, empowering you to make informed adjustments. By encompassing both gating resources and components, this feature accelerates root cause analysis and resolution improving planning efficiency and decision-making.​

 

 

Focused Access with Workbook Variants in Planner Workspaces 

Introducing a powerful new feature in Planner Workspaces that eliminates the need to scan large, unfiltered data sets to access the data you need. This targeted approach significantly reduces data volume, enhances speed and focus, and delivers a smoother experience to your planning process.

You can now segment your data using attributes like “Product ID” and “Customer ID”, allowing you to quickly select specific combinations and automatically filter your workbook accordingly.

In addition to the ability to save filters as workbook variants for convenient access (such as the product group you manage), you can easily proceed to the next item once you have finished reviewing the data.

 

Highlight the Data that Matters Most with AI-Driven Formatting Rules

The SAP IBP add-in for Microsoft Excel now harnesses the power of AI to help you create formatting rules using natural language. This groundbreaking feature allows you to surface key insights from large data sets, enhancing clarity, speed, and confidence in your decision-making process.

Simply type what you need, such as "Show two decimal places for available capacity," "Apply red font for unfulfilled demand greater than 0," or "Highlight the top 10% of sales revenues."

From quick formatting to advanced rules, AI instantly highlights the data that matters most, empowering you to navigate complex information with ease and stay focused on what truly drives your business forward.

This feature is currently available exclusively for early adopters. To test it, contact SAP using the SCM-IBP-XLS-UI component.

  

 

Foundation

End-to-End Processes with Cross-System Stock Transfers in Real Time 

A new real-time integration (RTI) feature increases planner visibility by tightly coupling purchase and sales orders in SAP IBP through a common stock transfer order. 

In customer environments with multiple SAP ERP, SAP S/4HANA on premise, and SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition systems, materials are transferred between plants of different systems or even between plants of different companies within the same ERP system. RTI now supports an end-to-end process of material transfers into harmonized planning areas and order-based planning areas with flexible master data. The purchase and sales orders required for transferring materials between ERP systems or companies are no longer loosely coupled documents, but they’re integrated as stock transfer orders.  

The integration supports cross-system and cross-company stock transfers, enabling stock transfers across multiple systems or companies for financial and tax benefits. Additionally, it facilitates smoother migrations from ERP systems to SAP S/4HANA. 

Simplified Job Scheduling with Joule

Excited to introduce a powerful new capability in Joule that brings job execution and monitoring right to your fingertips - no app-switching required.​

With this update, you can list your saved jobs with a simple ask and schedule jobs directly through Joule.​ You can also check job statuses, including your own jobs, failed jobs from today, or jobs created by colleagues.​

Whether you're triggering a forecasting run, managing S&OP, or executing order-based planning, Joule empowers you to act instantly from anywhere in the SAP Fiori UI: Just ask - and get it done.​

This is interactive planning, reimagined for speed and simplicity.

 

More Information

  • 2508 What’s New: Help Portal Documentation
  • What’s New in Best Practices
  • SAP IBP Community Page
  • SAP IBP Roadmap

  • Questions? Ask here

entry.title: Sync is not working for SSAM 2405 Custom Entity
entry.content:
Hello All,

We are encountering an issue in SAP Service and Asset Manager (SSAM) where the custom entity Z*  WO_CONFIRMATION is not being invoked during the POST (create) operation triggered from the mobile application. This custom entity is designed to handle additional fields required during the Work Order Confirmation process.

During investigation, we implemented a debugger to trace the backend logic. However, during synchronization, the debugger does not capture any call to the custom entity. Instead, only the standard Work Order Confirmation create logic is executed. On the other hand, the GET method for Z* WO_CONFIRMATION is successfully triggered during the initial load, confirming that the entity is accessible for read operations.

The intended design in the UI extension is to invoke the custom entity first to process the custom fields, followed by the standard Work Order Confirmation logic. The current behavior indicates that the custom POST logic is being bypassed entirely during syncing.

Thanks,

Melvin

entry.title: Excise tax in Public Cloud Edition
entry.content:
Our customer operates in the chemical industry and is required to pay energy tax/spirits tax in certain cases.

When selling products subject to energy tax, the energy tax is levied if the customer who wants to purchase this material does not have a permit or tax warehouse or is not allowed to purchase the material under general permission. The energy tax is then determined in the form of a condition type in the calculation schema of the sales order.

Currently, this is controlled in their R/3 system via Z tables, which are accessed via user exits or conditions in the terms and conditions. Energy tax is a legal requirement, so we assume that SAP offers a standard solution for this issue in the public cloud. Is there a scope item to solve this problem or other suggestions ? 4LO unfortunatlely  is just for Private cloud. 

Thanks in advance
and best regards

Silke Baumann

entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am currently working on a Flexible Workflow scenario for Sales Orders (SD) and I have a few questions:

  1. Sequential Approval Process

    • The business requirement is that one sales order should go through multiple approvals step by step ( Regional Approval → Finance Approval → Operations Approval → Final Approval).

    • If one approver rejects, the workflow should return back to the previous approver.

    • Is it possible to design this end-to-end approval chain within one workflow definition in Flexible Workflow, or do we need to trigger separate workflows one after another?

  2. Approval Visibility (Who Approved / Who is Pending)

    • Business users want to see clearly who already approved and whose approval is still pending for the same document.

    • Currently, in My Inbox, the approver only sees the header information of the sales order.

    •

Any guidance or best practices would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Build Workflow with SAP Build Process Automation: A Step-by-Step Demo on Invoice Validation Approval
entry.content:
Disclaimer: The insights shared in this blog are based on my personal observations and learning. They may not apply universally, and I encourage readers to conduct their own research and make an informed decision before using this content for productive use.

In this blog, we’ll walk through the steps to create your very first process using SAP Build Process Automation (SBPA). We’ll implement an Vendor Invoice Validation and Approval Process, where a Finance Clerk submits a vendor invoice, and a Finance Manager approves or rejects it. You'll also learn how to set up your environment in a SAP BTP trial account, configure prerequisites, and monitor your workflow execution.

Understanding SAP Build Solutions

SAP Build is a comprehensive suite of low-code/no-code tools that empowers citizen developers and business users to create applications and automate processes without extensive coding knowledge. The SAP Build portfolio consists of three main components:

SAP Build Apps

  • Create and extend business applications
  • Drag-and-drop simplicity for app development
  • No coding skills required

SAP Build Process Automation

  • Create workflows and automate repetitive tasks
  • Unifies workflow management and intelligent robotic process automation
  • Streamlines business process management

SAP Build Work Zone

  • Create beautiful business websites and corporate portals
  • Centralized access to business applications and content

All these tools leverage drag-and-drop functionality, making them accessible to users without programming expertise.

Prerequisites

  • SAP BTP Trial Setup
  • Ensure that you have a SAP BTP trial account with the following services enabled:   
  • A. SAP Build Process Automation (Free Tier or Standard Plan)
    • Navigate to Service Marketplace > Search for SAP Build Process Automation
    • Click Create Application if it’s not already available.

                  

  • B. SAP Cloud Identity Services (CIS)
    • Configure IAS (Identity Authentication Service).
    • Either use the default IAS tenant of your BTP trial or configure an additional tenant or default plan if needed.        

Subscribe to SAP Build Process Automation and Cloud Identity Service into your sub-account.         

  • Role Collection Assignment in BTP Cockpit
  • Assign the following role collections to the user you’ll log in with:                 

Go to BTP Cockpit > Security > Users

Select the IAS user and assign above role collection

  1. Establish Trust with IAS
  2. Go to BTP Subaccount > Security > Trust Configuration
  3. Add a new Identity Provider if you are using a custom IAS tenant
  4.  Enable trust for that IAS and assign the user created in IAS

Step 1: Accessing SAP Build Process Automation

  1. Navigate to your SAP BTP subaccount
  2. Go to Services → Instances and Subscriptions
  3. Open the SAP Build Process Automation application
  4. You'll be directed to the SAP Build Lobby - the central entry point for all SAP Build tools    

Step 2: Creating a Business Process Project

  1. In the SAP Build Lobby, click the Create button
  2. Select Build an Automated Process
  3. Choose Business Process
  4. Create a new project with these details:
    • Project Name: Invoice Validation Approval Process Form
    • Description: A invoice validation and approval process form project
  5. Click Create

The project acts as a container to hold the business process and all related artifacts.              

Step 3: Creating the Business Process

  1. Within the project, create a new business process:
    • Process Name: Invoice Validation Approval Process
    • Description: A invoice validation and approval process
  2. Click Create                  

The Process Builder will open with a vertical layout (an improvement from the previous horizontal layout) featuring a convenient side panel for better usability.

Hands-On Demo: Creating a Vendor Invoice Validation Approval Process

Let's dive into a practical example by creating a complete vendor invoice validation approval process. This demo will involve three key personas.

Business Personas Involved:

  1. Business Expert/Citizen Developer: Creates and designs the business process
  2. Finance Clerk: Uses the vendor invoice order from to initiate the process
  3. Finance Manager: Reviews and approves.rejects vendor invoice orders.

                    

Step 4: Creating the Vendor Invoice Submission Form (Trigger)

  1. Click Add a Trigger
  2. Select Submit Form (one of three trigger methods: Form, API, or Event)
  3. Click Blank Form
  4. Configure the form:
    • Form Name: Vendor Invoice Submission Form
    • Description: Form to collect vendor invoice order
  5. Click Create               

Step 5: Designing the Vendor Invoice Approval Form

  1. Click Open Editor to access the form designer
  2. Add form elements using drag-and-drop:
    • Heading: "Vendor Invoice Approval Forms"
    • Subheading: "Vendor Invoice Submission Form review by Finance Manager"
  3. Add required fields:
    • Vendor Name (Text field)
    • Invoice Number (Number field, required)
    • Invoice Date (Date field, required)
    • Vendor Email (Text field, required)
    • Invoice Amount (Number field, required)
    • Due Date (Date field, required)
  4. Mark fields as required where necessary
  5. Save the form       

Step 6: Creating the Approval Form

  1. Click Add Process Step (plus icon)
  2. Choose Approval
  3. Click Blank Approval
  4. Configure the approval form:
    • Name: Vendor Invoice Approval
    • Description: Vendor Invoice order form for review
  5. Click Create

Step 7: Designing the Approval Form

  1. Click the three dots and select Open Editor
  2. Design the form with:
    • Heading: "Sales Order Form for Review"
    • Subheading: "Sales order form for review by sales manager"
  3. Add the same fields as the trigger form:
    • Vendor Name
    • Invoice Number
    • Invoice Date
    • Vendor Email
    • Invoice Amount
    • Due Date
  4. Set all fields to Read Only (since this is for review)
  5. Add additional text field for manager comments
  6. Save the form

Step 8: Configuring the Approval Form

  1. Configure the approval settings:
    • Subject: "A Vendor Invoice [Vendor Name] form is waiting for your "
    • Priority: High
    • Users: Process started by (for simplification)
  2. Map inputs from the trigger form output:
    • Vendor Name→ Vendor Name field
    • Due Date → Due Date field
    • Invoice Number → Invoice Number field
    • Vendor Email → Vendor Email field
    • Invoice Amount → Invoice Amount field
  3. Save the configuration                     

Step 9: Creating Notification Forms

Approval Confirmation Form:

  1. Click Add Process Step → Form → Blank Form
  2. Configure:
    • Name: Vendor Invoice Order Confirmed
    • Description: Form to handle confirmation
  3. Design with:
    • Heading: "Vendor Invoice form approved successfully. No further action required."
    • Subject: "Your Vendor invoice [Vendor Name] form is confirmed!"
    • User: Process started by
  4. Save the form              

Rejection Notification Form:

  1. Go to Project Overview
  2. Duplicate the Order Confirmed form
  3. Modify the message:
    • Heading: "Invoice rejected. Please review remarks and resubmit after corrections."
    • Subject: "Your Vendor invoice [Vendor Name] has been rejected                   

Step 10: Connecting the Process Flow

  1. Connect the rejection notification to the "Rejected" path of the approval form
  2. Connect the approval confirmation to the "Approved" path
  3. Ensure both paths lead to the process end                      

Step 11: Understanding the Release Process

Why Release Before Deployment?

Before any business process can be executed by end users, it must go through two critical phases:

  1. Release: Creates a versioned snapshot of your project
  2. Deploy: Makes the released version available in runtime environment

Initiating the Release

  1. Locate the Release Button: In the top-right corner of your project interface
  2. Click Release: This opens the release configuration dialog

Release Versioning System

SAP Build Process Automation uses semantic versioning with three components:

  • Major Version (X.0.0): Significant changes, incompatible with previous versions
  • Minor Version (1.X.0): New features, backward compatible

First Release

For a newly created project, you'll see the default version 1.0.0. Add a meaningful release note such as "First release" and proceed.

Patch Changes (1.0.X)

  • Minor text modifications
  • Small UI adjustments
  • Bug fixes

Minor Changes (1.X.0)

  • New features added
  • Workflow enhancements
  • Backward-compatible improvements                       

Step 12: Deployment Process

Accessing Deployment Options

Once your project is released, the Deploy button becomes available. The deployment process involves:

  1. Click Deploy: Opens the deployment configuration
  2. Select Environment: Choose your target runtime environment

Understanding Environments

Public Environment

  • Accessible by all users in the subaccount
  • Suitable for organization-wide processes
  • Default choice for most scenarios

Deployment Execution

Select "Public" as your environment and click Deploy. You'll notice the project status changes from "Released" to "Deployed" and becomes "Active."       

Step 13: Process Execution and Testing

Accessing the Deployed Process

Once deployed, your process becomes executable through multiple channels:

  1. Direct Form Link: Browser-accessible URL
  2. SAP Build Work Zone Integration: Embedded as tiles
  3. SAP Launchpad Service: Integrated into portal environment         

Testing Scenario: Invoice Validation Approval Process Form

Phase 1: Finance Clerk Representative Role

Navigate to the deployed process and access the form link. As a finance clerk, fill out the order form:

Sample Data:

  • Vendor Name: ABCD Company
  • Invoice Number: 1234
  • Invoice Amount: $1,000
  • Due Date: 2 days from current date
  • Vendor Email : test@gmail.com
  • Invoice Date : 01/08/2025

Submit the form to initiate the workflow process.                           

Phase 2: Finance Manager Approval

  1. Access Inbox: Navigate to SAP Build Lobby > My Inbox
  2. Review Submission: Examine the submitted order details
  3. Make Decision: Choose to approve or reject based on business criteria

In our example:

  • Vendor Name: ABCD Company
  • Invoice Number: 1234
  • Invoice Amount: $1,000
  • Due Date: 2 days from current date
  • Vendor Email : test@gmail.com
  • Invoice Date : 01/08/2025

Decision: Approved with comment "This order can be fulfilled"      

Phase 3: Confirmation Process

After manager approval:

  1. Automatic Notification: System sends confirmation to finance representative
  2. Representative Action: Acknowledges receipt of approval
  3. Process Completion: Workflow concludes successfully

                        

Step 14: Process Monitoring and Analytics

Accessing Monitoring Tools

Process administrators can monitor workflow performance through: Path: SAP Build Lobby > Monitoring > Process and Workflow Instances

Key Monitoring Features

Process Instance Overview

  • Start time and initiator
  • Current status (Running, Completed, Failed)
  • Environment and version information
  • Instance ID for tracking

                     

Conclusion

SAP Build Process Automation is transforming the way organizations approach workflow digitisation by placing powerful automation tools directly in the hands of business users. As Demonstrated in our Invoice Validation Approval Process scenario, even non-technical users - like functional consultants or business experts - can quickly build, configure and deploy intelligent workflow using drag-and-drop interfaces, without writing code.  

From creating triggers  forms and configure approval steps to sending dynamic notifications, SBPA provides all the essential building blocks to automate repetitive tasks and improve collaboration across roles. Its tight integration within the SAP BTP and its ectensibility with tools like SAP Build Apps make it to go-to solutions.

By empowering citizen developer, SBPA not only reduces IT backlogs but also fosters a culture of innovations and continous improvement across teams. Now is the time to explore your business landscape, identify time-consuming manual process and turn them into streamlined intelligent workflows that deliver  measurable business value.

entry.title: Re: Manual Bank Reconciliation Start to End to Process in...
entry.content:
Hi @TAMS1 

Thank you for your questions.

Yes, manual bank reconciliation is fully supported in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition. This particular case is part of the scope item for Basic Cash Operations and I will gladly walk you through the exact steps on how you can achieve your target.

Before we proceed, please note, the Manage Bank Statements App, which is part of the standard Basic Cash Operations process. This App will help you enter bank statement lines manually, match those entries with actual system transaction, clear them, post any adjustments, and finally complete the reconciliation.

To resolve the issue, below are steps I suggest you follow:

  1. Set up your house bank and bank account in the system (this is a one-time configuration).
  2. Open the Manage Bank Statements app.
  3. Manually enter or upload the bank statement data (amounts, dates, etc.).
  4. SAP will suggest matches to open items (like supplier or customer payments).
  5. You can then manually reconcile those matches or post corrections if needed.
  6. Once everything is matched and cleared, your reconciliation is complete and reflected in your cash reports.

It is imperative to know that the system doesn’t require automation. If you can’t match some lines immediately, you can post a memo item or park them for follow-up. You do not require any extra activation if you’re using the relevant scope.

 

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

 

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Excise tax in Public Cloud Edition
entry.content:
SAP currently does not offer a dedicated scope item for excise or energy tax in S/4HANA Public Cloud. This means that custom logic or partner solutions are still required to handle complex tax scenarios like energy tax based on customer eligibility. Some partners like Krones, offer excise tax modules for S/4HANA, but not sure, it is available in Public Cloud

What you can do is continue using condition types in the pricing procedure to calculate energy tax, replace Z tables with Custom Business Objects in Public Cloud and use Custom Logic (via BAdIs or enhancement points) to determine tax applicability based on customer attributes.

If this is a legal requirement and affects multiple customers, consider submitting a Customer Influence request to SAP to prioritize development of a Public Cloud scope item.

entry.title: Exploring AI and next-gen Cloud ERP innovations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
The 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is out and this product blog by @BeSchulze give a great overview of the key innovation. With this update, SAP continues to push the boundaries of enterprise automation and intelligence. With the latest innovations powered by generative AI, customers benefit from improved transparency, faster decision-making, and simpler day-to-day operations. From financial consolidation to payment analysis and sustainability reporting, these updates bring intelligent capabilities directly into the flow of business. 

This video is very special as you will meet my new Synthesia avatar, who will give you a summary of the key "AI"-led innovations for this release. By the way, what do you think about this avatar? Let me know in the comments. 

 

Group Reporting: AI-assisted business insights for group financial statements review booklet

Building on the successful beta release in 2502, predefined AI-assisted business insights—also known as quick actions—are now generally available in the Group Financial Statements Review Booklet. These insights help streamline financial review processes by highlighting key figures, variances, and relevant context in natural language.

The Group Financial Statements Review Booklet, Cost Centers Review Booklet, and Project Financial Booklet – Professional Services now all include AI-powered business insights that enable faster analysis and easier interpretation of financial data. By reducing manual analysis effort and surfacing relevant context automatically, these booklets drive efficiency across various reporting tasks.

Figure 1: AI-assisted financial business insights

 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, AI-assisted payment exception analysis

In the Manage Automatic Payments app (App ID: F0770), a new AI capability enhances the process of analyzing payment exceptions after a payment proposal run. This feature not only provides natural language explanations of payment exceptions but also highlights relevant log entries and suggests resolution actions.

This innovation reduces the time spent investigating and resolving issues in payment proposals. By guiding users directly to the root cause and recommended next steps, the process becomes significantly more efficient—improving payment accuracy and minimizing delays in financial operations.

Figure 2: AI-assisted payment exception analysis

 

Figure 3: Digital Library - AI-Assisted Features

 

Enabling automatic allocations of carbon quantities by reflecting allocations in financial accounting

With growing importance on sustainable business practices, the 2508 release introduces automatic allocation of carbon quantities aligned with financial accounting data. This feature retrieves financial flow data from the connected system and automatically calculates account assignments, target accounts, and allocation ratios.

No manual calculation of receiver percentages is needed—carbon data is allocated consistently based on monetary values. This ensures alignment between sustainability and financial reporting, offering more precise reflection of operational impact and enabling integrated performance tracking across both domains.

Figure 4: Manage Allocations – Create from Financial Flow

 

Figure 5: Automatic allocation of carbon quantities

 

Unlock seamless data access with AI-assisted easy enterprise search 

Accessing business data is now even more intuitive with the AI-assisted easy enterprise search, which allows users to search using natural language. Instead of navigating through complex structures, a simple query like “Show me sales orders overall status in process” or “Show me open sales orders that have a net value greater than 100 EUR” provides relevant results instantly.

The system adapts the search results based on the user’s role, ensuring that only the most relevant business objects are presented. This not only improves search accuracy but also accelerates insight extraction—making it easier to act quickly and confidently in a data-rich environment. To enable this feature, select the 'enable AI natural language search' checkbox in the user profile settings.

 

Currently in beta testing: AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications 

Personalizing the My Home workspace becomes faster and smarter with the new AI-assisted smart personalization feature. Currently in beta testing, it allows users to tailor their applications and insight tiles using natural language.

Applications can be added in just two clicks, including a preview to confirm suitability. This streamlines customization, especially for new or infrequent users, by offering AI-powered suggestions, application descriptions, and live KPIs for dynamic tiles. The experience is intuitive and efficient, ensuring that personalization aligns with users’ daily workflows.

Interested in experiencing these improvements first-hand? Join the SAP beta testing for the latest AI-assisted features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and contribute to shaping future developments. For more information, see: Get Involved Early, and register today to help drive the evolution of AI advancements. 

 

Currently in beta testing: AI-assisted easy fill 

Also in beta, AI-assisted easy fill reimagines how form fields are completed. Instead of manually searching for and filling out fields, users can enter data via natural language. The system intelligently matches input to the correct fields and provides a clear overview before confirmation.

This innovation saves time, reduces navigation complexity, and increases accuracy in form completion. With automatic field matching and editable previews, easy fill offers a new level of convenience for maintaining business objects efficiently.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 delivers a powerful set of innovations that bridge insight and action with the support of generative AI. Whether it's optimizing financial processes, enhancing personalization, or improving sustainability reporting, these features demonstrate SAP’s commitment to building a truly intelligent cloud ERP system.

Interested in experiencing this enhanced feature? Join the SAP beta testing for the latest AI-assisted features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and contribute to shaping future developments. For more information, see: Get Involved Early, and register today to help drive the evolution of AI advancements. 

We’re also pleased to share that three recently introduced AI-assisted user experience innovations—enterprise search,easy filter,and smart summarization—are now available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition at no additional cost. To get started, simply accept the SAP AI Terms. Once completed, we’ll reach out to enable these capabilities on your tenants, so you can immediately begin benefiting from more intuitive interactions, faster insights, and enhanced productivity.

 

Joule for Business

With this release, Joule for Business brings a new dimension of intelligent assistance to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, enabling business users to interact with their systems through natural language while achieving impactful outcomes faster.

Figure 6: SAP Joule for Business

By embedding artificial intelligence directly into the system, Joule acts as a digital assistant that transforms how users navigate and operate business applications. It removes technical barriers by interpreting user intent and delivering contextually relevant results, all through intuitive, conversational interaction.

 

Simplifying service contract management

Joule for Business makes managing service contracts more seamless than ever. Users can describe their needs in natural language—for example, “show me my upcoming expiring service contracts”—and Joule provides direct access to the relevant apps such as Manage Service Contracts, Service Management Overview, and the Service Contracts Dashboard.

Figure 7: Navigational assistance to service contract management applications through Joule

From reviewing performance to processing contracts at scale, apps like Mass Processing of Service Contracts and Monitor Auto Renewal Logs become instantly accessible. This intuitive guidance enhances user satisfaction, shortens time to action, and significantly increases efficiency in service contract workflows.

 

Streamlining solution order management

For managing solution orders, Joule transforms user interaction into a results-driven experience. Whether the need is to assess order profitability or track fulfillment progress, users simply express what they want in natural language. Joule interprets the request and navigates directly to apps like Solution Orders Overview or Solution Order Profitability.

Figure 8: Navigational assistance to solution order management applications through Joule

This saves time, reduces manual steps, and lets users focus on driving outcomes rather than figuring out system navigation. Joule ensures that the most relevant tools are just a prompt away, transforming how users approach solution order management.

 

AI-Assisted sales order status check

In sales operations, timely status checks are critical. Joule for Business introduces an AI-powered capability to check the status of sales orders and flag any fulfillment issues. Instead of scanning through data manually, users can now ask questions like “What’s blocking the delivery of my sales order?”

Joule responds with natural language explanations of current statuses, highlights potential delays or issues, and offers resolution suggestions. It also provides direct access to relevant applications for follow-up actions—accelerating resolution and improving transparency in the sales process.

Figure 9: Joule AI-assisted sales order status check

Joule for Business continues to evolve as a powerful ally for business users, combining the strength of generative AI with SAP’s enterprise-grade reliability to make every interaction faster, smarter, and more human-centered.

 

Shaping the future of intelligent ERP - together

As AI continues to evolve, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition remains at the forefront—embedding intelligence directly into business processes to drive clarity, speed, and efficiency. With the 2508 release, generative AI is not just enhancing isolated tasks; it's transforming how work gets done across finance, sustainability, and user experience. Whether it’s simplifying complex reviews, automating routine actions, or making data more accessible, these innovations reflect a new standard for intelligent ERP.

We’re excited to continue this journey and invite you to explore these capabilities firsthand. Join our beta programs, share your feedback, and help shape the future of AI in the cloud. The momentum is strong—and this is only the beginning.

entry.title: Re: Consignment stock 3 not set in production order compo...
entry.content:
SAP does not automatically set the special stock indicator in production orders based solely on the special procurement key. Instead, you need to configure Stock Determination to achieve this behavior.

To achieve this, Define Stock Determination Strategy via ospx. Create a Stock Determination Group and Rule. In the rule, set priority 1 for special stock K (vendor consignment). Assign Strategy to Material via mm02. Assign Rule to Production Order Type via opj2. Assign the Stock Determination Rule to the Order Type and Plant. Set Operation for stock determination/batch determination to 3 or 4. Activate Stock Determination in Movement Type in SPRO > Materials Management > Inventory Management > Stock Determination > Assign SDR in the Applications. Here assign the rule to Movement Type 261.

Once this configuration is complete the special stock indicator “3” will be automatically proposed during production order creation. The IDoc generated for MES will include the correct stock type, avoiding manual intervention.

entry.title: HOW TO CHANGE MASS OBJECTS/TABLE BY MASS T-CODE?
entry.content:
Dear team,

 

As we have tools to create mass data on SAP, such as LSMW (for migration purposes), etc. However, MASS is created by and used SAP S4/HANA => in order to do similar changes to all of the fields of an object. For example, you want to mass change the texts of material, or you want to do mass change to similar materials to all the sales order, or you want to mark delivery completed to all Purchase orders, etc

 



In this case, we have to know each Object Type that related to the data we want to change. For example, in this case, we want to change the Sales Order, so we choose BUS2032


For the object we want to use and want to change, we can check on the t-code MASSOBJ to input the Object we want to change and details related to the Object. Since using MASSOBJ t-code is cross-client, please be careful do additional setup to this tcode. As I can show you the detail related to BUS2032- Sales order:


As you can see, the detail tables/fields of Sales order could be seen here easily.

Let’s get back to the MASS t-code.

 

  1. Input object type that needs to change 

     





  2. As you can see, there are a lot of options to mass change the sales order, at tables level, or fields level

    Table level

     

    Field level

     



  3. In this example, we will mass change header data of Sales orders => click execute

     



    As you can see, we also have options that “Import Data from File” for large amount of data that we need to change

     

  4. Input the needed data here, as you can see, MASS do support to create new data




    We can go through the details and see how the change applied by click on “Display All Records” or Chg. In Background.



    Chg. In Background is used in this case.

  5. As you can see, there are many fields related to Sales Order Header Level as imagine below. In this case, I choose the reference field:


     




  6. As you can see below, we can do mass changes as below
    .

    I will input "DAVE" as New value


    Click Transfer => Field get updated

  7. As you can see on the table view and on the log changes of Sales order:



 

As MASS tool is a very powerful tool/t-code to change mass object, please keep in mind that this change could impact both master data and transactional data. You could engage it first on testing environment before running it on production to make sure the field you change is correct.

Thank you and have a nice day,

Dave

entry.title: Re: Batch Jobs for processing Billing document request of...
entry.content:
SAP uses a two-step billing process for service contracts:

  • BDRs are created from billing request lines in the service contract.
  • Invoices are created from BDRs via the billing due list.

If BDRs are not being collected, it likely means they were not created yet.  Changing the billing type to F2 bypasses the BDR step and directly creates invoices, which is not ideal for service contracts.

Use the “Schedule Billing Document Request Creation” app to generate BDRs from service contracts. This job should run daily to ensure BDRs are created for all open billing request lines. Make sure the service contracts are in Released status. Refer to SAP Help  Billing of Service Transactions

Use the “Create Billing Documents” app to convert BDRs into invoices. This job should also run daily, after the BDR creation job. Set the billing type to F2 (or your desired invoice type). Ensure that the BDRs are included in the billing due list.

 

Each billing request line in a service contract creates one BDR item, even if dates overlap.

If BDRs are missing, check the billing status in the service contract item’s billing plan section.

entry.title: Re: ePPDS resource cannot be deleted as only model-depend...
entry.content: Hi, yes...the problem is not the deletion, but the inconsistency, as the model-independent entry is missing. I opened an OSS towards SAP and got the solution: 2325595 - Resources in inactive planning version only - Solution Use report Z_RES_HARD_DEL to delete the resources from database. Implementation 1. Create report Z_RES_HARD_DEL using transaction SE38. 2. Paste source code that can be found in attachment Z_RES_HARD_DEL.txt 3. Define the following Text Symbols Symbol Text 001 Prepare 002 Select 003 Delete 004 Finish 005 Resources Found 006 Resources Deleted 007 Do you really want to delete the resources from the database? 008 Action cancelled 009 Entries from table /SAPAPO/RESKEY not deleted. 010 Simversion must be blank to delete /SAPAPO/RESKEY 4. Define the following Selection Texts Name Text P_TEST Test Mode SO_NAME Resource Name SO_GUID Resource GUID SO_VRSEX Simversion Name SO_VRSID Simversion GUID 5. Activate Make sure to maintain texts mentioned above for the logon language used by your user or use this report only in the language for which this report has been created in your system. The report requires entering a resource name or resource GUID. Initial parameters will be ignored, entering "*" is respected. When you enter one or multiple simversions, the resources only for those simversions will be deleted. If you want to delete the whole resource including the entry in database table /SAPAPO/RESKEY, simversion name and simversion GUID must be left blank. There is no consistency check. Selected resources will be deleted from database. Therefore, the report should only be used for inconsistent resources that cannot be deleted in any other way. Test mode is available. Warning: If you should want to use it for different approaches, please make sure, the entered resources are not in use anymore, before running the report. Otherwise the system will go into an inconsistent status that cannot be repaired anymore. Run liveCache consistency check for resources (detailed) after running the report.

entry.title: How to Join IDoc data (EDID4) with MSEG to Map REM Yield/Consumption to Planned Orders in SQVI?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm trying to create a custom report for our business user in SQVI to replicate the output of MB51, which I want to display the REM planned order number associated with each yield/consumption posting. Current challenge that I'm facing is that in REM, once the MES system sends data via IDoc, the postings are created in SAP against a cost collector (unlike discrete manufacturing whereby the postings will be against a production order).

My objective:

1. To build a report that mimics MB51 (based on MSEG + MKPF).

2. In the report each yield and consumption posting will be linked to each planned order.

3. The report also can be filtered by posting/entry dates.

 

I have done a bit of study and I've found that these tables below contains the information that I need in the report:

1. EDID4: Contains SData which includes the planned/work order, material, plant, etc.

2. EDIDC: Contains the timestamp of the IDoc

3. MSEG: Material document items

4. MKPF: For header data

 

So the challenge that I face:

1. The planned order number is available inside EDID4-SData as part of raw string.

2. There is no common fields that can link EDID4 with MSEG

3. SQVI does not support parsing SData, so I cannot extract the planned order field directly.

4. I have tried to join PLAF with MSEG + MKPF, however once I have generated the report, the planned order number is incorrectly mapped to each transaction. For example, even though I have filtered the transaction date as 30th July, there are old planned orders (May planned orders) and planned orders that yet to release (Dec 2025 planned orders) are displayed in the report. 

 

Is there any way to make this work in SQVI? Or is a custom ABAP/Z-table is the only viable path? Thanks in advance for your insights!

entry.title: Re: Automatic Reorder Point (MRP Type: V2 or VM) Planning - Part 2
entry.content:
Hello,

To answer the few queries please find the detailed explanation below.

Given: Historical Monthly Consumption

Month Consumption (units)

Jan 100
Feb 90
Mar 110
Apr 95
May 105
Jun 100
Total 600


Step 1: Calculate the Mean (Average)

Mean = (100 + 90 + 110 + 95 + 105 + 100) / 6 = 600 / 6 = 100


---

Step 2: Calculate Deviation from Mean for Each Month

Month Consumption Deviation (x - mean) Squared Deviation

Jan 100 0 0
Feb 90 -10 100
Mar 110 +10 100
Apr 95 -5 25
May 105 +5 25
Jun 100 0 0
Total = 250

 

---

Step 3: Calculate Variance

Since this is a sample (not population), we divide by (n - 1):

Variance = Total Squared Deviations / (n - 1)
= 250 / (6 - 1)
= 250 / 5 = 50


---

Step 4: Take Square Root of Variance → Standard Deviation

Standard Deviation (σ) = √50 ≈ 7.07 units/month


---

Step 5: Convert Monthly to Daily Std. Dev.

Assuming ~30 days per month:

σ_daily = 7.07 / √30 ≈ 1.29 units/day

This daily standard deviation is what you’d use in the Safety Stock formula:

Safety Stock = Z × σ_daily × √Lead Time
= 1.65 × 1.29 × √10
≈ 1.65 × 1.29 × 3.16 ≈ 6.71 units → rounded to 7

Forecast Calculation (Constant Model)

Formula:

Forecast = Total Consumption / Number of Periods
= 600 / 6 = 100 units/month

To get daily consumption:

100 units / 30 days ≈ 3.33 units/day

 

Please acknowledge if it is helpful for you...

 

Thanks 

Manoj

entry.title: How to use Cloud SDK for AI in an existing CAP NodeJS Project in CommonJS
entry.content:
I have an existing SAP Cloud Application Program Project in CommonJs. I want to add custom AI function in it . So need to use SAP Cloud SDK for AI in my project. But SAP Cloud SDK for AI only support native ESM.  Convert my existing project into ESM? I think it is too risky.  I need to use the ESM module in the CommonJs project.  At last, it works. Let me share the steps which maybe be helpful for you.

Steps:

1,  Install esbuild in the root path of my project:
npm i esbuild
2.  Create  folder named esm under  srv, then create a file named index.js under folder esm with the following code .
import { OrchestrationClient, buildAzureContentSafetyFilter } from '@sap-ai-sdk/orchestration';
import { AzureOpenAiEmbeddingClient } from '@sap-ai-sdk/langchain'

export { OrchestrationClient, buildAzureContentSafetyFilter, AzureOpenAiEmbeddingClient };
2.  Add following script in my package.json file in project root path.
 "deps": "esbuild --platform=node srv/esm/index.js --bundle --outfile=srv/esm/bundle.js"

3.  Run the following command in the project root path in terminal.
npm run deps

4.  Adjust the code of importing the module of SAP Cloud SDK for AI as the following.
// const { OrchestrationClient, buildAzureContentSafetyFilter } = require('@sap-ai-sdk/orchestration');
const { OrchestrationClient, buildAzureContentSafetyFilter } = require('../esm/bundle');
// const { AzureOpenAiEmbeddingClient } = require('@sap-ai-sdk/langchain');
const { AzureOpenAiEmbeddingClient } = require('../esm/bundle');

 

 

The ends!

Thanks for your time!

Jacky Liu

entry.title: Re: AR Aging Analysis in Account Receivable Overview
entry.content:
Hi @12345678901 

Thanks for reaching out.

I will walk you through how you can achieve your target for the following:

  • How to calculate the “Net Overdue” percentage in the AR Aging Analysis section
  • How to calculate the percentage of AR collected

 

How SAP Calculates the “Net Overdue” Percentage

You’re referring to the AR Aging Analysis tile, which shows a 15.7% Net Overdue for More Than Interval 1 Days. Below are steps required for the calculation:

  1. The first step is to Open the “Accounts Receivable Overview” app. This is your starting point for all AR analytics.
  2. Then, take Look at the “AR Aging Analysis” tile and take note of the percentage shown (e.g., 15.7%).
  3. Next is to Scroll down to view aging bucket values for example:
  • Overdue receivables 1.73 M (based on your screenshot)
  • Total receivables 11.0 M (based on your screenshot)
  1. You can also carry out a manual calculation using the SAP formula as stated below:

Net Overdue % = Overdue Amount ÷ Total Receivables × 100

                            = 1.73 ÷ 11.0 × 100             

                            = 15.7%

 

How you can Calculate % of AR Collected

To get total AR open amount (as of start of month), the first step is to:

  • Open the “Accounts Receivable Overview” app
  • Note total open receivables that is displayed.

The go ahead to get collected AR for the period

  • You will need to use the “Cash Flow Analyzer” or “Incoming Payments” app
  • Make sure to “filter by date range” for example you can filter for the current month if this applies.
  • Take note of the “Total collected” data displayed

The following manual calculation displayed below provides you the steps required:

AR Collection % = Collected Amount ÷ Total Starting AR × 100

                = 2.5 ÷ 11.0 × 100

                = 22.7%

Note that this gives you the collection performance rate for that period.

 

Optionally, you can “Overdue Receivables Today” App. This app provides more insights into how you can manage overdue aging structure, by customer, region, or sales area. You can also export the data into Excel for more detailed reconciliation.

Please note the following for a successful solution:

  • The AR Aging percentage only considers open and overdue items cleared items are excluded.
  • The percentages are dynamic and reflect real-time system data.

The following page provides further information.

SAP Help: Accounts Receivable Overview

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Incorrect transfer TR to the production system if the...
entry.content:
Hello,

 

In the standard ChaRM and STMS  configuration , once a transport request is imported in the pre-production, STMS will do a "selection for import" in the production system (it will be added automatically to the import queue of the production system). So, if you have a ChaRM periodic import job running at 6 a.m. for production system import, the transport request will be imported into production. This is normal and expected.

 

To prevent this, ChaRM has got a configuration called "Status-dependent import strategy". You can read more about it in SAP KBA 2453216 , which has links to the configuration help pages for status dependent import. If you run into any issues, you may search the SAP Knowledge Base with the keyword /TMWFLOW/VC_IMPS, and you will find the corrections for known issues, hints about particular errors, etc.

 

Best regards,

 

Miguel Ariño
